quality_assessment: Excellent documentation with accurate syntax, comprehensive examples, and proper source code references. All command types are thoroughly documented with correct field descriptions.
positive_aspects: All six command types (shell, claude, goal_seek, foreach, write_file, validate) are documented
Each command type includes accurate source code references
Syntax examples match the actual struct definitions in code
Comprehensive field documentation with correct types and options
Real-world examples from actual workflow files
Clear explanation of command exclusivity with valid/invalid examples
Deprecated test command is properly documented with migration guidance
All internal markdown links are valid and point to existing files
Common fields section provides unified documentation for shared options
Use cases listed for each command type help readers understand applications
improvement_suggestions: Consider adding a troubleshooting section for common command-related errors
Could include a comparison matrix showing which fields are available for each command type
Add examples showing command chaining with on_success/on_failure for complex workflows
Consider adding performance notes about foreach parallel execution vs MapReduce
Could mention environment variable interpolation in command strings

metadata.validation_focus: Check all command types are documented
